explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Flash point 79 degC (closed-cup) (IUCLID (2000)) is >60 degC and <=93 degC.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Auto-ignition point is 630 degC (Incompatible Hazard Handbook of Chemicals (Tokyo Fire Department, 1997)) exceeding 70 degC.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on LD50 values of 606, 782 and 720 mg/kg for rats (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified into Category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of >5000 mg/kg for rats (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified as "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on a LC50 value of 1.92 mg/L (4h) for rats (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified into Category 4. Since the LC50 value was higher than the saturated vapour pressure concentration (4.3E-05 mg/L), the classification criteria for mist was adopted.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on a result of "slightly irritating" in a rabbit test (OECD TG404) (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified as "Not classified".

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on results of "little irritative" or "not irritating" in a rabbit Draize tests (OECD TG405) (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified as "Not classified".

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Although there is a report of "not sensitizing" in a guinea pig test (IUCLID (2000)), classification was not possible since the details are not clear.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on a negative result in an intraperitoneal mouse bone marrow micronucleus test (OECD TG474 (GLP)) (in vivo somatic cell mutagenicity tests) (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified as "Not classified". As relevant information, from in vitro mutagenicity tests, there is a report of a negative Ames test (NTP DB (access on Sep. 2009)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is a report for a developmental toxicity test by oral administration in rats during the organogenesis period (days 6 - 15 of gestation) in which maternal effects such as decrease in food consumption were observed. There were no teratogenic or embryotoxic effects (IUCLID (2000)). Classification was not possible due to lack of data for sexual function and fertility of parental animals.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (central nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on a report of signs of toxicity such as cyanosis, disorders of balance and palmospasms in a rat oral test (LD50; 606 mg/kg) and a report of signs of toxicity such as ataxia and tremors in a rat inhalation test (LC50; 1.92 mg/L) (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified into Category 2 (central nervous system).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: In a rat 28-day oral test (OECD TG407), haemosiderosis in the spleen and Kupffers cells, splenic extramedullary haematopoiesis and hyperaemia were observed in all treated groups (10, 50, 25 mg/kg/day, 90-day equivalence: 3 mg/kg/day and above) (IUCLID (2000)). Although these dose levels correspond to Category 1, the substance was classified into Category 2 (blood system) because of information in List 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2 from its 48h-EC50 = 1.3 mg/L for Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE, 2010).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2 since its acute toxicity is Category 2 and it is not rapidly degradable (Non-biodegradable, decomposition by BOD degradation rate: 0% (Biodegradation and Bioconcentration of Existing Chemical Substances under the Chemical Substances Control Law, 1977)).
